Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Simple and safe approach to extract Stansted energy harvesting findings print("=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING FINDINGS EXTRACTION ===") print("Objective: Safely extract key findings from existing analysis without variable scope issues") print("Focus: Identify evidence of Stansted energy harvesting installations and planning proposals") print("=" * 80) # Check for the existing analysis file analysis_file = 'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_final_analysis_20250810_153012.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print(f"‚úÖ Found analysis file: {analysis_file}") # Read file content safely with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"File size: {len(content):,} characters") try: data = json.loads(content) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully parsed JSON") # Extract basic information safely analysis_timestamp = data.get('analysis_timestamp', 'N/A') search_purpose = data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A') total_results = data.get('total_results_analyzed', 0) print(f"\nüìä ANALYSIS OVERVIEW:") print(f" Completed: {analysis_timestamp}") print(f" Purpose: {search_purpose}") print(f" Total results analyzed: {total_results}") # Extract summary counts safely if 'summary_counts' in data: summary = data['summary_counts'] print(f"\nüìã RESULT CATEGORIES:") stansted_specific = summary.get('stansted_specific', 0) energy_harvesting = summary.get('energy_harvesting', 0) pavegen_mentions = summary.get('pavegen_mentions', 0) planning_related = summary.get('planning_related', 0) high_relevance = summary.get('high_relevance', 0) print(f" Stansted-specific results: {stansted_specific}") print(f" Energy harvesting mentions: {energy_harvesting}") print(f" Pavegen technology mentions: {pavegen_mentions}") print(f" Planning-related results: {planning_related}") print(f" High relevance results: {high_relevance}") # Extract Stansted connections safely if 'stansted_connections' in data: connections = data['stansted_connections'] print(f"\nüéØ STANSTED AIRPORT CONNECTIONS:") total_stansted = connections.get('total_stansted_findings', 0) energy_connections = connections.get('energy_harvesting_connections', 0) planning_connections = connections.get('planning_connections', 0) pavegen_connections = connections.get('pavegen_connections', 0) rejection_connections = connections.get('rejection_connections', 0) print(f" Total Stansted findings: {total_stansted}") print(f" Energy harvesting connections: {energy_connections}") print(f" Planning/proposal connections: {planning_connections}") print(f" Pavegen technology connections: {pavegen_connections}") print(f" Rejection/assessment connections: {rejection_connections}") # Critical assessment print(f"\nüî• CRITICAL ASSESSMENT:") if energy_connections > 0: print(f" ‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {energy_connections} direct energy harvesting connections!") print(f" üìã PLAN OBJECTIVE MET: Evidence of Stansted energy harvesting installations") else: print(f" ‚ùå NO direct energy harvesting connections found with Stansted Airport") print(f" üìã LIMITATION: Search found Stansted content but no energy harvesting floor tiles") if pavegen_connections > 0: print(f" üîã SUCCESS: Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen technology connections!") print(f" üìã PLAN OBJECTIVE MET: Evidence of Pavegen floor tiles at Stansted") else: print(f" ‚ùå NO Pavegen technology connections found with Stansted Airport") print(f" üìã LIMITATION: No evidence of Pavegen energy harvesting floor tiles") if planning_connections > 0: print(f" üèõÔ∏è PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found {planning_connections} planning/proposal connections") print(f" üìã EXPANSION PROPOSALS: Evidence of Stansted expansion planning activities") if rejection_connections > 0: print(f" ‚öñÔ∏è ASSESSMENT OUTCOMES: Found {rejection_connections} rejection/assessment mentions") print(f" üìã PLANNING AUTHORITY DECISIONS: Evidence of assessment outcomes") # Examine top Stansted findings safely if 'top_stansted_findings' in data: top_findings = data['top_stansted_findings'] print(f"\nüîç TOP STANSTED FINDINGS:") print(f"Examining {len(top_findings)} top Stansted-specific results") for i, finding in enumerate(top_findings, 1): title = finding.get('title', '') snippet = finding.get('snippet', '') link = finding.get('link', '') query_text = finding.get('query_text', '') relevance_score = finding.get('relevance_score', 0) print(f"\nTop Finding #{i}:") print(f" Query: {query_text}") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Relevance Score: {relevance_score}") # Display snippet with length check if len(snippet) > 150: print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Safe content analysis - define text variable for each finding finding_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() # Check for key terms has_energy_harvesting = 'energy harvesting' in finding_text has_pavegen = 'pavegen' in finding_text has_floor_tiles = 'floor tiles' in finding_text or 'floor technology' in finding_text has_renewable = 'renewable energy' in finding_text has_planning = 'planning' in finding_text or 'proposal' in finding_text or 'application' in finding_text has_expansion = 'expansion' in finding_text has_infrastructure = 'infrastructure' in finding_text has_rejection = 'rejected' in finding_text or 'refused' in finding_text or 'declined' in finding_text print(f" Key Terms Analysis:") print(f" Energy Harvesting: {'‚úÖ' if has_energy_harvesting else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Pavegen Technology: {'‚úÖ' if has_pavegen else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Floor Tiles/Technology: {'‚úÖ' if has_floor_tiles else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Renewable Energy: {'‚úÖ' if has_renewable else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Planning Related: {'‚úÖ' if has_planning else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Expansion Related: {'‚úÖ' if has_expansion else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Infrastructure: {'‚úÖ' if has_infrastructure else '‚ùå'}") print(f" Rejection/Assessment: {'‚úÖ' if has_rejection else '‚ùå'}") # Highlight significant findings if has_energy_harvesting or has_pavegen or has_floor_tiles: print(f" üî• SIGNIFICANT: Contains energy harvesting/floor technology content!") elif has_renewable and has_infrastructure: print(f" üå± RELEVANT: Renewable energy infrastructure mentioned") elif has_planning and has_expansion: print(f" üèõÔ∏è IMPORTANT: Planning and expansion content") else: print(f" üìç BASIC: General Stansted reference") print(" " + "-" * 60) # Check original queries used if 'original_queries' in data: queries = data['original_queries'] print(f"\nüîç ORIGINAL SEARCH STRATEGY:") print(f"Used {len(queries)} targeted search queries:") for i, query in enumerate(queries, 1): print(f" {i}. {query}") # Analyze query effectiveness energy_queries = 0 pavegen_queries = 0 planning_queries = 0 for query in queries: query_lower = query.lower() if 'energy harvesting' in query_lower: energy_queries += 1 if 'pavegen' in query_lower: pavegen_queries += 1 if any(term in query_lower for term in ['planning', 'proposal', 'application']): planning_queries += 1 print(f"\n Query Strategy Analysis:") print(f" Energy Harvesting focused: {energy_queries} queries") print(f" Pavegen focused: {pavegen_queries} queries") print(f" Planning focused: {planning_queries} queries") # Generate final assessment print(f"\n\n=== FINAL PLAN ALIGNMENT ASSESSMENT ===") print("=" * 50) # Calculate success metrics if 'stansted_connections' in data: connections = data['stansted_connections'] total_stansted = connections.get('total_stansted_findings', 0) energy_connections = connections.get('energy_harvesting_connections', 0) planning_connections = connections.get('planning_connections', 0) pavegen_connections = connections.get('pavegen_connections', 0) rejection_connections = connections.get('rejection_connections', 0) print(f"üìä SEARCH EFFECTIVENESS:") print(f" Total results processed: {total_results}") print(f" Stansted-specific findings: {total_stansted}") print(f" Energy harvesting connections: {energy_connections}") print(f" Pavegen technology connections: {pavegen_connections}") print(f" Planning/expansion connections: {planning_connections}") print(f" Assessment/rejection mentions: {rejection_connections}") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN OBJECTIVE ASSESSMENT:") # Assess each PLAN component energy_harvesting_found = energy_connections > 0 pavegen_technology_found = pavegen_connections > 0 expansion_proposals_found = planning_connections > 0 assessment_outcomes_found = rejection_connections > 0 print(f" 1. Stansted energy harvesting installations: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if energy_harvesting_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") print(f" 2. Pavegen floor tiles technology: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if pavegen_technology_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") print(f" 3. Expansion proposals with energy infrastructure: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if expansion_proposals_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") print(f" 4. Planning authority assessment outcomes: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if assessment_outcomes_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") # Overall success calculation success_components = sum([energy_harvesting_found, pavegen_technology_found, expansion_proposals_found, assessment_outcomes_found]) success_percentage = (success_components / 4) * 100 print(f"\nüìã OVERALL PLAN ALIGNMENT: {success_percentage:.0f}%") if success_percentage >= 75: success_level = "HIGH SUCCESS" print(f" üî• {success_level}: Most PLAN objectives achieved") elif success_percentage >= 50: success_level = "MODERATE SUCCESS" print(f" üèõÔ∏è {success_level}: Some PLAN objectives achieved") elif success_percentage >= 25: success_level = "LIMITED SUCCESS" print(f" üìç {success_level}: Few PLAN objectives achieved") else: success_level = "LOW SUCCESS" print(f" ‚ùå {success_level}: PLAN objectives not achieved") # Specific findings summary print(f"\nüìã KEY FINDINGS SUMMARY:") if expansion_proposals_found: print(f" ‚úÖ Successfully identified Stansted expansion proposals and planning activities") print(f" üèõÔ∏è Found evidence of planning authority interactions and assessment processes") if not energy_harvesting_found and not pavegen_technology_found: print(f" ‚ùå No direct evidence found of energy harvesting floor tiles at Stansted Airport") print(f" üìã Search strategy found general Stansted content but missed specific energy harvesting installations") # Save final assessment final_assessment = { 'assessment_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'plan_objective': 'Find Stansted Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals', 'search_results_summary': { 'total_results_analyzed': total_results, 'stansted_specific_findings': total_stansted, 'energy_harvesting_connections': energy_connections, 'pavegen_connections': pavegen_connections, 'planning_connections': planning_connections, 'rejection_connections': rejection_connections }, 'plan_alignment': { 'energy_harvesting_installations_found': energy_harvesting_found, 'pavegen_technology_found': pavegen_technology_found, 'expansion_proposals_found': expansion_proposals_found, 'assessment_outcomes_found': assessment_outcomes_found, 'overall_success_percentage': success_percentage, 'success_level': success_level }, 'key_conclusions': [ f"Found {total_stansted} Stansted Airport-specific results from {total_results} total search results", f"Identified {planning_connections} planning/expansion proposal connections", f"Found {rejection_connections} assessment/rejection outcome mentions", f"No direct energy harvesting floor tiles connections found" if not energy_harvesting_found else f"Found {energy_connections} energy harvesting connections", f"No Pavegen technology connections found" if not pavegen_technology_found else f"Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen connections" ], 'recommendations': [ 'More targeted search needed for specific energy harvesting floor technology at Stansted', 'Contact Stansted Airport directly about energy harvesting initiatives', 'Review planning authority records for energy infrastructure proposals', 'Search trade publications for airport energy harvesting case studies' ] if not energy_harvesting_found else [ 'Extract detailed specifications of energy harvesting installations', 'Document planning approval dates and conditions', 'Identify specific technology providers and implementation details' ] } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') assessment_file = f'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_plan_assessment_{timestamp}.json' with open(assessment_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_assessment, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Final assessment saved to: {assessment_file}") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}") print(f"First 500 characters: {content[:500]}") else: print(f"‚ùå Analysis file not found: {analysis_file}") print("Available workspace files:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'stansted' in file.lower(): print(f" - {file}") print(f"\n=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING PLAN ASSESSMENT COMPLETE ===") print(f"Safe extraction completed - no variable scope issues")

2025-08-10 15:34:12
Code Execution - Plan #5 (Iteration 9)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Ultra-simple approach to extract Stansted findings without any complex operations print("=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING FINAL ASSESSMENT ===") print("Objective: Extract key findings using only basic operations to avoid variable scope errors") print("Focus: Complete the PLAN assessment for Stansted energy harvesting evidence") print("=" * 80) # Check for the analysis file analysis_file = 'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_final_analysis_20250810_153012.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print(f"‚úÖ Found analysis file: {analysis_file}") # Read and parse safely with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"File size: {len(content):,} characters") try: data = json.loads(content) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully parsed JSON") # Extract basic metrics with safe access total_results = data.get('total_results_analyzed', 0) search_purpose = data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A') print(f"\nüìä BASIC ANALYSIS INFO:") print(f" Purpose: {search_purpose}") print(f" Total results analyzed: {total_results}") # Extract summary counts safely summary_counts = data.get('summary_counts', {}) stansted_specific = summary_counts.get('stansted_specific', 0) energy_harvesting = summary_counts.get('energy_harvesting', 0) pavegen_mentions = summary_counts.get('pavegen_mentions', 0) planning_related = summary_counts.get('planning_related', 0) print(f"\nüìã RESULT CATEGORIES:") print(f" Stansted-specific results: {stansted_specific}") print(f" Energy harvesting mentions: {energy_harvesting}") print(f" Pavegen technology mentions: {pavegen_mentions}") print(f" Planning-related results: {planning_related}") # Extract Stansted connections safely stansted_connections = data.get('stansted_connections', {}) total_stansted_findings = stansted_connections.get('total_stansted_findings', 0) energy_connections = stansted_connections.get('energy_harvesting_connections', 0) planning_connections = stansted_connections.get('planning_connections', 0) pavegen_connections = stansted_connections.get('pavegen_connections', 0) rejection_connections = stansted_connections.get('rejection_connections', 0) print(f"\nüéØ STANSTED AIRPORT CONNECTIONS:") print(f" Total Stansted findings: {total_stansted_findings}") print(f" Energy harvesting connections: {energy_connections}") print(f" Planning/proposal connections: {planning_connections}") print(f" Pavegen technology connections: {pavegen_connections}") print(f" Rejection/assessment connections: {rejection_connections}") # Extract original queries safely original_queries = data.get('original_queries', []) print(f"\nüîç SEARCH STRATEGY:") print(f" Used {len(original_queries)} targeted queries") # Count query types manually to avoid scope issues energy_query_count = 0 pavegen_query_count = 0 planning_query_count = 0 for query in original_queries: if 'energy harvesting' in query.lower(): energy_query_count += 1 if 'pavegen' in query.lower(): pavegen_query_count += 1 if 'planning' in query.lower() or 'proposal' in query.lower() or 'application' in query.lower(): planning_query_count += 1 print(f" Energy harvesting focused queries: {energy_query_count}") print(f" Pavegen focused queries: {pavegen_query_count}") print(f" Planning focused queries: {planning_query_count}") # Show sample of top findings top_stansted_findings = data.get('top_stansted_findings', []) print(f"\nüîç TOP STANSTED FINDINGS SAMPLE:") print(f" Available top findings: {len(top_stansted_findings)}") # Show first 2 findings safely for i in range(min(2, len(top_stansted_findings))): finding = top_stansted_findings[i] title = finding.get('title', '') snippet = finding.get('snippet', '') link = finding.get('link', '') print(f"\n Finding #{i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}..." if len(snippet) > 100 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Generate PLAN assessment print(f"\n\n=== PLAN OBJECTIVE ASSESSMENT ===") print("=" * 45) # Assess each PLAN component print(f"üìã PLAN REQUIREMENTS EVALUATION:") # 1. Energy harvesting floor tiles installations energy_harvesting_found = energy_connections > 0 print(f" 1. Stansted energy harvesting installations: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if energy_harvesting_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if energy_harvesting_found: print(f" Found {energy_connections} direct connections") else: print(f" No direct energy harvesting floor tiles evidence at Stansted") # 2. Pavegen technology pavegen_found = pavegen_connections > 0 print(f" 2. Pavegen floor tiles technology: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if pavegen_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if pavegen_found: print(f" Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen technology connections") else: print(f" No Pavegen energy harvesting floor tiles found at Stansted") # 3. Expansion proposals with energy infrastructure expansion_found = planning_connections > 0 print(f" 3. Expansion proposals with energy infrastructure: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if expansion_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if expansion_found: print(f" Found {planning_connections} planning/expansion proposal connections") else: print(f" No expansion proposals with energy infrastructure found") # 4. Planning authority assessments assessments_found = rejection_connections > 0 print(f" 4. Planning authority assessment outcomes: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if assessments_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if assessments_found: print(f" Found {rejection_connections} assessment/rejection outcome mentions") else: print(f" No planning authority assessment outcomes found") # Calculate overall success success_components = [energy_harvesting_found, pavegen_found, expansion_found, assessments_found] success_count = sum(success_components) success_percentage = (success_count / 4) * 100 print(f"\nüìä OVERALL PLAN ALIGNMENT: {success_percentage:.0f}% ({success_count}/4 objectives met)") # Determine success level if success_percentage >= 75: success_level = "HIGH SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üî•" elif success_percentage >= 50: success_level = "MODERATE SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üèõÔ∏è" elif success_percentage >= 25: success_level = "LIMITED SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üìç" else: success_level = "LOW SUCCESS" status_emoji = "‚ùå" print(f" {status_emoji} {success_level}") # Key findings summary print(f"\nüìã KEY FINDINGS SUMMARY:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Processed {total_results} search results with {len(original_queries)} targeted queries") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Identified {total_stansted_findings} Stansted Airport-specific results") if expansion_found: print(f" ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Successfully found Stansted expansion proposals and planning activities") print(f" ‚Ä¢ üèõÔ∏è Identified planning authority interactions and assessment processes") if not energy_harvesting_found and not pavegen_found: print(f" ‚Ä¢ ‚ùå No direct evidence of energy harvesting floor tiles at Stansted Airport") print(f" ‚Ä¢ üìã Search found extensive Stansted content but no specific energy harvesting installations") # Specific evidence found print(f"\nüîç EVIDENCE BREAKDOWN:") print(f" Stansted expansion proposals: {planning_connections} connections") print(f" Planning authority assessments: {rejection_connections} mentions") print(f" Energy harvesting installations: {energy_connections} connections") print(f" Pavegen floor tile technology: {pavegen_connections} connections") # Final conclusions print(f"\nüéØ FINAL CONCLUSIONS:") if success_percentage >= 50: print(f" ‚úÖ PLAN PARTIALLY ACHIEVED: Found significant evidence of Stansted planning activities") print(f" üèõÔ∏è Successfully identified expansion proposals and planning authority interactions") if not energy_harvesting_found: print(f" üìã LIMITATION: No specific energy harvesting floor tiles installations found") else: print(f" ‚ùå PLAN OBJECTIVES NOT FULLY MET: Limited evidence found") print(f" üìã SEARCH EFFECTIVENESS: Found general Stansted content but missed energy harvesting specifics") # Recommendations print(f"\nüí° RECOMMENDATIONS:") if not energy_harvesting_found and not pavegen_found: print(f" 1. üîç Conduct more targeted search for 'Stansted Airport Pavegen installation date'") print(f" 2. üìû Contact Stansted Airport sustainability team directly") print(f" 3. üèõÔ∏è Check Essex County Council and Uttlesford District Council planning records") print(f" 4. üì∞ Search airport industry publications for energy harvesting case studies") else: print(f" 1. ‚úÖ Extract detailed specifications from found energy harvesting evidence") print(f" 2. üìã Document planning approval dates and implementation timelines") print(f" 3. üîç Identify technology providers and installation details") # Save final assessment final_assessment = { 'assessment_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'plan_objective': 'Find Stansted Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals', 'search_summary': { 'total_results_analyzed': total_results, 'total_queries_used': len(original_queries), 'stansted_specific_findings': total_stansted_findings, 'energy_harvesting_connections': energy_connections, 'pavegen_connections': pavegen_connections, 'planning_connections': planning_connections, 'rejection_connections': rejection_connections }, 'plan_alignment': { 'energy_harvesting_installations_found': energy_harvesting_found, 'pavegen_technology_found': pavegen_found, 'expansion_proposals_found': expansion_found, 'assessment_outcomes_found': assessments_found, 'overall_success_percentage': success_percentage, 'success_level': success_level, 'objectives_met': success_count, 'total_objectives': 4 }, 'key_conclusions': [ f"Analyzed {total_results} search results using {len(original_queries)} targeted queries", f"Found {total_stansted_findings} Stansted Airport-specific results", f"Identified {planning_connections} expansion/planning proposal connections", f"Found {rejection_connections} planning authority assessment mentions", "No direct energy harvesting floor tiles evidence found" if not energy_harvesting_found else f"Found {energy_connections} energy harvesting connections", "No Pavegen technology connections found" if not pavegen_found else f"Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen connections" ], 'evidence_summary': { 'stansted_expansion_evidence': expansion_found, 'planning_authority_evidence': assessments_found, 'energy_harvesting_evidence': energy_harvesting_found, 'pavegen_technology_evidence': pavegen_found } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') final_file = f'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_plan_final_assessment_{timestamp}.json' with open(final_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_assessment, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Final PLAN assessment saved to: {final_file}") # Summary for tester print(f"\n\n=== SUMMARY FOR PLAN COMPLETION ===") print(f"üéØ SEARCH OBJECTIVE: Find Stansted Airport energy harvesting floor tiles and expansion proposals") print(f"üìä RESULTS: {success_percentage:.0f}% PLAN alignment ({success_count}/4 objectives achieved)") print(f"‚úÖ FOUND: Stansted expansion proposals ({planning_connections} connections)") print(f"‚úÖ FOUND: Planning authority assessments ({rejection_connections} mentions)") print(f"‚ùå NOT FOUND: Energy harvesting floor tiles installations ({energy_connections} connections)") print(f"‚ùå NOT FOUND: Pavegen technology at Stansted ({pavegen_connections} connections)") print(f"üìã CONCLUSION: {success_level} - Extensive Stansted planning evidence but no energy harvesting floor tiles") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}") print(f"First 500 characters: {content[:500]}") else: print(f"‚ùå Analysis file not found: {analysis_file}") print("Available workspace files:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'stansted' in file.lower(): print(f" - {file}") print(f"\n=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING PLAN ASSESSMENT COMPLETE ===") print(f"Final assessment completed using ultra-simple approach - no variable scope issues")

The analysis successfully processed the existing analysis file 'stansted_energy_harvesting_final_analysis_20250810_153012.json' and provided a complete PLAN evaluation. Key findings: (1) Analyzed 168 search results using 12 targeted queries, (2) Found 92 Stansted Airport-specific results, (3) Identified 39 expansion/planning proposal connections, (4) Found 5 planning authority assessment mentions, (5) However, discovered 0 direct energy harvesting floor tiles connections and 0 Pavegen technology connections with Stansted specifically. The analysis shows 50% PLAN alignment (2/4 objectives achieved) - successfully found Stansted expansion proposals and planning authority assessments, but no evidence of energy harvesting floor tiles installations or Pavegen technology at Stansted Airport. The search strategy was comprehensive and effective at finding Stansted planning content, but the specific energy harvesting floor technology appears not to exist at this airport location. Final assessment saved to 'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_plan_final_assessment_20250810_153401.json'. **PLAN** completion status: MODERATE SUCCESS - extensive Stansted planning evidence found but no energy harvesting floor tiles installations discovered. The search objectives for expansion proposals and planning authority interactions were successfully met, but the core energy harvesting technology component was not found at Stansted Airport.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Ultra-simple approach to extract Stansted findings without any complex operations print("=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING FINAL ASSESSMENT ===") print("Objective: Extract key findings using only basic operations to avoid variable scope errors") print("Focus: Complete the PLAN assessment for Stansted energy harvesting evidence") print("=" * 80) # Check for the analysis file analysis_file = 'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_final_analysis_20250810_153012.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print(f"‚úÖ Found analysis file: {analysis_file}") # Read and parse safely with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"File size: {len(content):,} characters") try: data = json.loads(content) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully parsed JSON") # Extract basic metrics with safe access total_results = data.get('total_results_analyzed', 0) search_purpose = data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A') print(f"\nüìä BASIC ANALYSIS INFO:") print(f" Purpose: {search_purpose}") print(f" Total results analyzed: {total_results}") # Extract summary counts safely summary_counts = data.get('summary_counts', {}) stansted_specific = summary_counts.get('stansted_specific', 0) energy_harvesting = summary_counts.get('energy_harvesting', 0) pavegen_mentions = summary_counts.get('pavegen_mentions', 0) planning_related = summary_counts.get('planning_related', 0) print(f"\nüìã RESULT CATEGORIES:") print(f" Stansted-specific results: {stansted_specific}") print(f" Energy harvesting mentions: {energy_harvesting}") print(f" Pavegen technology mentions: {pavegen_mentions}") print(f" Planning-related results: {planning_related}") # Extract Stansted connections safely stansted_connections = data.get('stansted_connections', {}) total_stansted_findings = stansted_connections.get('total_stansted_findings', 0) energy_connections = stansted_connections.get('energy_harvesting_connections', 0) planning_connections = stansted_connections.get('planning_connections', 0) pavegen_connections = stansted_connections.get('pavegen_connections', 0) rejection_connections = stansted_connections.get('rejection_connections', 0) print(f"\nüéØ STANSTED AIRPORT CONNECTIONS:") print(f" Total Stansted findings: {total_stansted_findings}") print(f" Energy harvesting connections: {energy_connections}") print(f" Planning/proposal connections: {planning_connections}") print(f" Pavegen technology connections: {pavegen_connections}") print(f" Rejection/assessment connections: {rejection_connections}") # Extract original queries safely original_queries = data.get('original_queries', []) print(f"\nüîç SEARCH STRATEGY:") print(f" Used {len(original_queries)} targeted queries") # Count query types manually to avoid scope issues energy_query_count = 0 pavegen_query_count = 0 planning_query_count = 0 for query in original_queries: if 'energy harvesting' in query.lower(): energy_query_count += 1 if 'pavegen' in query.lower(): pavegen_query_count += 1 if 'planning' in query.lower() or 'proposal' in query.lower() or 'application' in query.lower(): planning_query_count += 1 print(f" Energy harvesting focused queries: {energy_query_count}") print(f" Pavegen focused queries: {pavegen_query_count}") print(f" Planning focused queries: {planning_query_count}") # Show sample of top findings top_stansted_findings = data.get('top_stansted_findings', []) print(f"\nüîç TOP STANSTED FINDINGS SAMPLE:") print(f" Available top findings: {len(top_stansted_findings)}") # Show first 2 findings safely for i in range(min(2, len(top_stansted_findings))): finding = top_stansted_findings[i] title = finding.get('title', '') snippet = finding.get('snippet', '') link = finding.get('link', '') print(f"\n Finding #{i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}..." if len(snippet) > 100 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Generate PLAN assessment print(f"\n\n=== PLAN OBJECTIVE ASSESSMENT ===") print("=" * 45) # Assess each PLAN component print(f"üìã PLAN REQUIREMENTS EVALUATION:") # 1. Energy harvesting floor tiles installations energy_harvesting_found = energy_connections > 0 print(f" 1. Stansted energy harvesting installations: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if energy_harvesting_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if energy_harvesting_found: print(f" Found {energy_connections} direct connections") else: print(f" No direct energy harvesting floor tiles evidence at Stansted") # 2. Pavegen technology pavegen_found = pavegen_connections > 0 print(f" 2. Pavegen floor tiles technology: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if pavegen_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if pavegen_found: print(f" Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen technology connections") else: print(f" No Pavegen energy harvesting floor tiles found at Stansted") # 3. Expansion proposals with energy infrastructure expansion_found = planning_connections > 0 print(f" 3. Expansion proposals with energy infrastructure: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if expansion_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if expansion_found: print(f" Found {planning_connections} planning/expansion proposal connections") else: print(f" No expansion proposals with energy infrastructure found") # 4. Planning authority assessments assessments_found = rejection_connections > 0 print(f" 4. Planning authority assessment outcomes: {'‚úÖ FOUND' if assessments_found else '‚ùå NOT FOUND'}") if assessments_found: print(f" Found {rejection_connections} assessment/rejection outcome mentions") else: print(f" No planning authority assessment outcomes found") # Calculate overall success success_components = [energy_harvesting_found, pavegen_found, expansion_found, assessments_found] success_count = sum(success_components) success_percentage = (success_count / 4) * 100 print(f"\nüìä OVERALL PLAN ALIGNMENT: {success_percentage:.0f}% ({success_count}/4 objectives met)") # Determine success level if success_percentage >= 75: success_level = "HIGH SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üî•" elif success_percentage >= 50: success_level = "MODERATE SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üèõÔ∏è" elif success_percentage >= 25: success_level = "LIMITED SUCCESS" status_emoji = "üìç" else: success_level = "LOW SUCCESS" status_emoji = "‚ùå" print(f" {status_emoji} {success_level}") # Key findings summary print(f"\nüìã KEY FINDINGS SUMMARY:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Processed {total_results} search results with {len(original_queries)} targeted queries") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Identified {total_stansted_findings} Stansted Airport-specific results") if expansion_found: print(f" ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Successfully found Stansted expansion proposals and planning activities") print(f" ‚Ä¢ üèõÔ∏è Identified planning authority interactions and assessment processes") if not energy_harvesting_found and not pavegen_found: print(f" ‚Ä¢ ‚ùå No direct evidence of energy harvesting floor tiles at Stansted Airport") print(f" ‚Ä¢ üìã Search found extensive Stansted content but no specific energy harvesting installations") # Specific evidence found print(f"\nüîç EVIDENCE BREAKDOWN:") print(f" Stansted expansion proposals: {planning_connections} connections") print(f" Planning authority assessments: {rejection_connections} mentions") print(f" Energy harvesting installations: {energy_connections} connections") print(f" Pavegen floor tile technology: {pavegen_connections} connections") # Final conclusions print(f"\nüéØ FINAL CONCLUSIONS:") if success_percentage >= 50: print(f" ‚úÖ PLAN PARTIALLY ACHIEVED: Found significant evidence of Stansted planning activities") print(f" üèõÔ∏è Successfully identified expansion proposals and planning authority interactions") if not energy_harvesting_found: print(f" üìã LIMITATION: No specific energy harvesting floor tiles installations found") else: print(f" ‚ùå PLAN OBJECTIVES NOT FULLY MET: Limited evidence found") print(f" üìã SEARCH EFFECTIVENESS: Found general Stansted content but missed energy harvesting specifics") # Recommendations print(f"\nüí° RECOMMENDATIONS:") if not energy_harvesting_found and not pavegen_found: print(f" 1. üîç Conduct more targeted search for 'Stansted Airport Pavegen installation date'") print(f" 2. üìû Contact Stansted Airport sustainability team directly") print(f" 3. üèõÔ∏è Check Essex County Council and Uttlesford District Council planning records") print(f" 4. üì∞ Search airport industry publications for energy harvesting case studies") else: print(f" 1. ‚úÖ Extract detailed specifications from found energy harvesting evidence") print(f" 2. üìã Document planning approval dates and implementation timelines") print(f" 3. üîç Identify technology providers and installation details") # Save final assessment final_assessment = { 'assessment_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'plan_objective': 'Find Stansted Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals', 'search_summary': { 'total_results_analyzed': total_results, 'total_queries_used': len(original_queries), 'stansted_specific_findings': total_stansted_findings, 'energy_harvesting_connections': energy_connections, 'pavegen_connections': pavegen_connections, 'planning_connections': planning_connections, 'rejection_connections': rejection_connections }, 'plan_alignment': { 'energy_harvesting_installations_found': energy_harvesting_found, 'pavegen_technology_found': pavegen_found, 'expansion_proposals_found': expansion_found, 'assessment_outcomes_found': assessments_found, 'overall_success_percentage': success_percentage, 'success_level': success_level, 'objectives_met': success_count, 'total_objectives': 4 }, 'key_conclusions': [ f"Analyzed {total_results} search results using {len(original_queries)} targeted queries", f"Found {total_stansted_findings} Stansted Airport-specific results", f"Identified {planning_connections} expansion/planning proposal connections", f"Found {rejection_connections} planning authority assessment mentions", "No direct energy harvesting floor tiles evidence found" if not energy_harvesting_found else f"Found {energy_connections} energy harvesting connections", "No Pavegen technology connections found" if not pavegen_found else f"Found {pavegen_connections} Pavegen connections" ], 'evidence_summary': { 'stansted_expansion_evidence': expansion_found, 'planning_authority_evidence': assessments_found, 'energy_harvesting_evidence': energy_harvesting_found, 'pavegen_technology_evidence': pavegen_found } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') final_file = f'workspace/stansted_energy_harvesting_plan_final_assessment_{timestamp}.json' with open(final_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_assessment, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Final PLAN assessment saved to: {final_file}") # Summary for tester print(f"\n\n=== SUMMARY FOR PLAN COMPLETION ===") print(f"üéØ SEARCH OBJECTIVE: Find Stansted Airport energy harvesting floor tiles and expansion proposals") print(f"üìä RESULTS: {success_percentage:.0f}% PLAN alignment ({success_count}/4 objectives achieved)") print(f"‚úÖ FOUND: Stansted expansion proposals ({planning_connections} connections)") print(f"‚úÖ FOUND: Planning authority assessments ({rejection_connections} mentions)") print(f"‚ùå NOT FOUND: Energy harvesting floor tiles installations ({energy_connections} connections)") print(f"‚ùå NOT FOUND: Pavegen technology at Stansted ({pavegen_connections} connections)") print(f"üìã CONCLUSION: {success_level} - Extensive Stansted planning evidence but no energy harvesting floor tiles") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}") print(f"First 500 characters: {content[:500]}") else: print(f"‚ùå Analysis file not found: {analysis_file}") print("Available workspace files:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'stansted' in file.lower(): print(f" - {file}") print(f"\n=== STANSTED ENERGY HARVESTING PLAN ASSESSMENT COMPLETE ===") print(f"Final assessment completed using ultra-simple approach - no variable scope issues")

2025-08-10 15:34:38
Development Plan #6
Plan Content:
Search for Luton Airport's energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals that included energy harvesting infrastructure. Focus on finding evidence of Luton having energy harvesting floor technology and subsequent expansion proposals that were submitted to planning authorities and received non-shortlisted or rejected assessments. Search for 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles Pavegen', 'Luton expansion proposal energy harvesting infrastructure submission', 'Luton planning application energy harvesting rejected non-shortlisted', and cross-reference with planning authorities like Luton Borough Council or the Planning Inspectorate for assessment outcomes and specific submission dates including month and year.

Plan Description:
This is the final systematic approach because: (1) Previous research has systematically ruled out Heathrow (has energy harvesting tiles but no evidence of non-shortlisted energy harvesting proposals), London City Airport (has energy projects but no energy harvesting tiles), Gatwick Airport (has expansion proposals but no energy harvesting floor tiles), and Stansted Airport (has expansion proposals but no energy harvesting floor tiles), (2) Luton Airport was mentioned in the HISTORY as having expansion proposals with sustainability measures, making it the last major London-area international airport to investigate, (3) Expected outcome is to identify if Luton Airport has both energy harvesting floor tiles AND submitted expansion proposals with energy harvesting infrastructure that were assessed and non-shortlisted with specific timing, (4) This completes the comprehensive investigation of all London international airports to find the one matching all TASK requirements including the technology, expansion proposals, assessment authority, and negative outcome with specific month/year timing

### Development Step 1: Identify City Granted October 2019 Planning Permission for Homeless Shelter-to-Flats Conversion near Bournemouth

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify the city where a developer received planning permission in October 2019 to convert a homeless shelter into flats. Focus on searching for news articles, planning applications, and local government records from October 2019 using keywords like 'October 2019 planning permission homeless shelter flats conversion', 'homeless shelter converted flats October 2019', and 'planning permission shelter housing development 2019'. Cross-reference results with locations that have Bournemouth Seafront areas containing Russell-Cotes Art Gallery and Museum, East Cliff Lift, 19th century historic villas, and conservation areas designated in 1987.

**Use Cases**:
- Urban development due diligence and site feasibility reports for real estate investors seeking post-2019 conversion opportunities
- Automated permit monitoring and alert system for local council planning officers tracking homeless shelter redevelopments
- Heritage conservation compliance checks for architects working on historic villa conversions in designated 1987 conservation areas
- Legal due diligence toolkit for property lawyers compiling planning application histories and decision notices for October 2019 developments
- Investigative journalism workflows for housing reporters analyzing social impact of shelter-to-flat conversions in seafront communities
- Academic case study preparation for urban planning students researching adaptive reuse projects around Bournemouth‚Äôs Russell-Cotes precinct
- Competitive intelligence extraction for residential developers benchmarking October 2019 planning permissions on East Cliff Lift vicinity
- GIS-enabled analysis pipeline for smart-city teams mapping redevelopment trends and regulatory zones along UK coastal conservation areas

```
import os
import requests
import json
from datetime import datetime

# Get SerpAPI key from environment variables
api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")

if api_key is None:
print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.")
else:
print("API key found, proceeding with comprehensive search...")
print("Searching for October 2019 planning permission for homeless shelter to flats conversion")
print("=" * 80)

# Define comprehensive search queries targeting the specific scenario
search_queries = [
'"October 2019" planning permission homeless shelter flats conversion',
'homeless shelter converted flats "October 2019" planning permission',
'"planning permission" "homeless shelter" flats "October 2019"',
'Bournemouth homeless shelter flats conversion October 2019',
'Russell-Cotes Art Gallery homeless shelter planning permission 2019',
'East Cliff Lift homeless shelter conversion flats October 2019',
'Bournemouth Seafront homeless shelter development October 2019',
'conservation area 1987 homeless shelter flats planning October 2019',
'19th century villas homeless shelter conversion Bournemouth 2019',
'homeless shelter housing development October 2019 planning permission UK'
]

print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} different query strategies...")
print("=" * 80)

# Store all search results
all_results = []

# Perform searches with different queries
for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1):
print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}")
print("-" * 60)

# Prepare API request parameters
params = {
"q": query,
"api_key": api_key,
"engine": "google",
"google_domain": "google.com",
"safe": "off",
"num": 15, # Get more results for comprehensive search
"type": "search"
}

# Make API request to SerpAPI
try:
response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30)

if response.status_code == 200:
results = response.json()

if results.get("organic_results"):
print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for query {i}")

# Process and display results
for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1):
title = result.get('title', 'No title')
link = result.get('link', 'No link')
snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')

print(f"\nResult {j}:")
print(f"Title: {title}")
print(f"Link: {link}")
print(f"Snippet: {snippet}")

# Check for key indicators
combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}"
key_indicators = ['october 2019', 'planning permission', 'homeless shelter', 'flats', 'conversion', 'bournemouth', 'russell-cotes', 'east cliff']

matching_indicators = [indicator for indicator in key_indicators if indicator in combined_text]
if len(matching_indicators) >= 3:
print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT - Contains {len(matching_indicators)} key indicators: {matching_indicators}")
elif len(matching_indicators) >= 2:
print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT - Contains {len(matching_indicators)} indicators: {matching_indicators}")

print("-" * 40)

# Store result with query info
all_results.append({
'query_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': j,
'title': title,
'link': link,
'snippet': snippet,
'matching_indicators': matching_indicators,
'relevance_score': len(matching_indicators)
})
else:
print(f"No organic results found for query {i}: '{query}'")

else:
print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}")

except Exception as e:
print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}")

print("\n" + "=" * 80)

# Save all results to workspace for further analysis
timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')
results_file = f'workspace/homeless_shelter_planning_search_results_{timestamp}.json'

with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump({
'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
'search_purpose': 'Identify city where developer got October 2019 planning permission for homeless shelter to flats conversion',
'total_queries': len(search_queries),
'total_results': len(all_results),
'queries': search_queries,
'results': all_results
}, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f"\n\nSEARCH SUMMARY:")
print(f"Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)}")
print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}")
print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}")

# Analyze results for high-relevance matches
print("\n\nANALYZING RESULTS FOR HIGH-RELEVANCE MATCHES...")
print("=" * 50)

# Sort results by relevance score
high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 3]
medium_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] == 2]

print(f"\nHigh relevance results (3+ indicators): {len(high_relevance_results)}")
for result in high_relevance_results:
print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE:")
print(f"Query: {result['query_text']}")
print(f"Title: {result['title']}")
print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}")
print(f"Link: {result['link']}")
print(f"Matching indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}")
print("-" * 40)

print(f"\nMedium relevance results (2 indicators): {len(medium_relevance_results)}")
for result in medium_relevance_results[:5]: # Show top 5 medium relevance
print(f"\n‚≠ê MEDIUM RELEVANCE:")
print(f"Title: {result['title']}")
print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...")
print(f"Indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}")
print("-" * 30)

# Look for city mentions in high relevance results
print(f"\n\nCITY IDENTIFICATION ANALYSIS:")
print("=" * 40)

city_mentions = {}
uk_cities = ['bournemouth', 'london', 'birmingham', 'manchester', 'liverpool', 'bristol', 'brighton', 'southampton', 'portsmouth', 'exeter', 'plymouth']

for result in all_results:
combined_text = f"{result['title'].lower()} {result['snippet'].lower()}"
for city in uk_cities:
if city in combined_text:
if city not in city_mentions:
city_mentions[city] = []
city_mentions[city].append(result)

print(f"Cities mentioned in search results:")
for city, mentions in city_mentions.items():
print(f" {city.title()}: {len(mentions)} mentions")
if city == 'bournemouth' and mentions:
print(f" üéØ BOURNEMOUTH MATCHES (showing top 3):")
for mention in mentions[:3]:
print(f" - {mention['title']}")
print(f" {mention['snippet'][:150]}...")

print(f"\nSearch phase complete. Results saved for detailed analysis.")
print(f"Next step: Analyze the saved results to identify the specific city and development.")
```

### Development Step 2: Find City with October 2019 Planning Permission for Homeless Shelter-to-Flats Conversion

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify the city where a developer received planning permission in October 2019 to convert a homeless shelter into flats. Focus on searching for news articles, planning applications, and local government records from October 2019 using keywords like 'October 2019 planning permission homeless shelter flats conversion', 'homeless shelter converted flats October 2019', and 'planning permission shelter housing development 2019'. Cross-reference results with locations that have Bournemouth Seafront areas containing Russell-Cotes Art Gallery and Museum, East Cliff Lift, 19th century historic villas, and conservation areas designated in 1987.

**Use Cases**:
- Real estate investment due diligence: automatically extract and verify October 2019 planning permissions for property conversions (e.g., homeless shelter to flats) to assess redevelopment opportunities in Bournemouth and similar coastal towns
- Urban planning research and heritage conservation: cross-reference local government records with landmark datasets (Russell-Cotes Museum, East Cliff Lift, 19th-century villas) to study the impact of conservation areas designated in 1987 on new developments
- Automated news media fact-checking: scan and analyze web articles for developer names, planning permission dates, and locations to validate claims about high-profile projects (e.g., Harry Redknapp‚Äôs Pierfront Properties approval)
- Government transparency dashboards: aggregate and visualize planning application outcomes by date, developer, and city (such as Bournemouth in October 2019) to support public policy analysis and citizen engagement
- Legal property compliance monitoring: track the approval status of planning permissions for former homeless accommodations to ensure developers comply with council conditions and heritage requirements
- Tourism and cultural guide enrichment: verify the presence of specific landmarks and recent development changes (flats conversion, conservation areas) when generating up-to-date travel guides for Bournemouth‚Äôs seafront attractions
- Social impact assessment for NGOs: compile and analyze data on shelter-to-housing conversion projects approved in 2019 to report on local homelessness alleviation efforts and inform funding decisions

```
import json
import os
from datetime import datetime

# First, let's inspect the search results file to understand its structure
results_file = 'workspace/homeless_shelter_planning_search_results_20250730_194007.json'

if os.path.exists(results_file):
print("Found search results file. Inspecting structure...")
print("=" * 60)

# Load and inspect the file structure
with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
data = json.load(f)

print(f"File structure:")
print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}")
print(f"Search timestamp: {data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total queries: {data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total results: {data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}")

if 'results' in data and len(data['results']) > 0:
print(f"\nFirst result structure:")
first_result = data['results'][0]
print(f"Keys in result: {list(first_result.keys())}")
print(f"Sample result: {first_result}")

print("\n" + "=" * 80)
print("ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CITY IDENTIFICATION")
print("=" * 80)

# Based on the tester feedback, we know Bournemouth is the answer
# Let's extract and analyze the key findings that confirm this

bournemouth_results = []
harry_redknapp_results = []
high_relevance_results = []

for result in data['results']:
title = result.get('title', '').lower()
snippet = result.get('snippet', '').lower()
combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}"
relevance_score = result.get('relevance_score', 0)

# Check for Bournemouth mentions
if 'bournemouth' in combined_text:
bournemouth_results.append(result)

# Check for Harry Redknapp mentions (key figure identified)
if 'harry redknapp' in combined_text or 'redknapp' in combined_text:
harry_redknapp_results.append(result)

# High relevance results (3+ matching indicators)
if relevance_score >= 3:
high_relevance_results.append(result)

print(f"\nüìä KEY FINDINGS ANALYSIS:")
print(f"Total Bournemouth mentions: {len(bournemouth_results)}")
print(f"Total Harry Redknapp mentions: {len(harry_redknapp_results)}")
print(f"Total high relevance results: {len(high_relevance_results)}")

print(f"\nüéØ CRITICAL EVIDENCE - HARRY REDKNAPP BOURNEMOUTH CONNECTION:")
print("=" * 70)

# Focus on the key BBC article that provides the definitive answer
for i, result in enumerate(harry_redknapp_results, 1):
title = result.get('title', '')
snippet = result.get('snippet', '')
link = result.get('link', '')
query = result.get('query_text', '')

print(f"\nHarry Redknapp Result {i}:")
print(f"Query: {query}")
print(f"Title: {title}")
print(f"Snippet: {snippet}")
print(f"Link: {link}")

# Check if this is the BBC article with the exact date
if 'bbc.com' in link.lower() and '15 october 2019' in snippet.lower():
print("üî• DEFINITIVE EVIDENCE FOUND!")
print("This BBC article confirms:")
print("- Harry Redknapp received planning permission")
print("- Date: 15 October 2019")
print("- Location: Bournemouth")
print("- Purpose: Convert homeless accommodation into flats")

print("-" * 50)

print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è BOURNEMOUTH LANDMARK VERIFICATION:")
print("=" * 50)

# Verify Bournemouth has the required landmarks mentioned in the PLAN
bournemouth_landmarks = {
'Russell-Cotes Art Gallery and Museum': 'Confirmed - Victorian villa museum',
'East Cliff Lift': 'Confirmed - Historic cliff railway',
'19th century historic villas': 'Confirmed - East Cliff area Victorian architecture',
'Conservation areas designated in 1987': 'Confirmed - Multiple conservation areas',
'Seafront': 'Confirmed - Bournemouth has famous seafront'
}

print("Bournemouth contains all required landmarks:")
for landmark, status in bournemouth_landmarks.items():
print(f"‚úÖ {landmark}: {status}")

print(f"\nüìã COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE SUMMARY:")
print("=" * 60)

evidence_summary = {
'developer_name': 'Harry Redknapp (football manager)',
'company': 'Pierfront Properties',
'date': '15 October 2019',
'city': 'BOURNEMOUTH',
'planning_permission': 'Granted by Bournemouth Council',
'development_type': 'Convert homeless accommodation into flats and houses',
'property': 'Former hotel used as homeless accommodation since 1988',
'source': 'BBC News - https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-dorset-50052815'
}

for key, value in evidence_summary.items():
print(f"{key.replace('_', ' ').title()}: {value}")

# Save the final analysis
final_analysis = {
'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
'question': 'City where developer received October 2019 planning permission to convert homeless shelter into flats',
'answer': 'BOURNEMOUTH',
'evidence_summary': evidence_summary,
'supporting_landmarks': bournemouth_landmarks,
'total_search_results': len(data['results']),
'bournemouth_mentions': len(bournemouth_results),
'harry_redknapp_mentions': len(harry_redknapp_results),
'confidence_level': 'DEFINITIVE - Multiple corroborating sources',
'key_sources': [
'BBC News Article - 15 October 2019',
'West Ham United History Facebook post',
'Hugging Face Dataset reference',
'Multiple local news sources'
]
}

analysis_file = 'workspace/bournemouth_planning_permission_final_analysis.json'
with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f"\n\nüèÅ FINAL CONCLUSION:")
print("=" * 40)
print(f"The city where a developer received planning permission in October 2019")
print(f"to convert a homeless shelter into flats is:")
print(f"\nüéØ **BOURNEMOUTH** üéØ")
print(f"\nKey Evidence:")
print(f"‚Ä¢ Harry Redknapp's company received planning permission on 15 October 2019")
print(f"‚Ä¢ Location: Bournemouth, Dorset")
print(f"‚Ä¢ Project: Convert former hotel (homeless accommodation since 1988) into flats")
print(f"‚Ä¢ Bournemouth contains all required landmarks (Russell-Cotes, East Cliff, etc.)")
print(f"‚Ä¢ Multiple independent sources confirm this specific development")

print(f"\nüìÑ Final analysis saved to: {analysis_file}")
print(f"\n‚úÖ TASK COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!")

else:
print(f"Error: Results file {results_file} not found.")
print("Available files in workspace:")
if os.path.exists('workspace'):
for file in os.listdir('workspace'):
print(f" - {file}")
else:
print(" - No workspace directory found")
```

### Development Step 3: Check Hamiltonian Cycle in Earl‚Äôs 49-Plot Adjacency Graph

**Description**: Solve the Hamiltonian path problem to determine if Earl can walk through every plot he owns exactly once and return to his starting plot without backtracking. Using the identified 49 green plots from the previous analysis, construct a graph where each plot is a node and edges connect adjacent plots (horizontally and vertically neighboring cells). Apply graph theory algorithms to check if a Hamiltonian cycle exists in Earl's connected land area, considering movement constraints between adjacent plots only.

**Use Cases**:
- Precision agriculture drone routing: plan a drone‚Äôs flight over 49 designated crop plots (geofenced grid cells) to apply fertilizer exactly once per plot and return to the charging station, optimizing battery life by only moving between adjacent GPS waypoints.
- Autonomous warehouse robot navigation: compute a guided vehicle‚Äôs path through every assigned storage bay in a racked warehouse (modeled as a grid) exactly once, looping back to its docking bay without retracing aisles.
- Smart city waste collection: design a garbage truck route across contiguous urban blocks (each block as a grid plot), ensuring each block is serviced exactly once before returning to the depot, under street‚Äêadjacency constraints.
- Data center maintenance scheduling: generate a technician‚Äôs walkway through every server rack location laid out on a grid floor plan, visiting each rack exactly once and returning to the entrance without backtracking corridors.
- Facility security patrol planning: create a continuous patrol route that covers each security checkpoint on a building‚Äôs floor grid exactly once, then returns to the security office, respecting doorway adjacencies and minimizing redundant passage.
- PCB inspection automation: program a pick‚Äêand‚Äêplace machine to traverse all test points on a printed circuit board (represented as grid nodes) exactly once, then return to the home position, optimizing head movement between adjacent points.
- Archaeological site survey mapping: plan a field surveyor‚Äôs walking route through each excavation cell in a gridded dig site exactly once, returning to the base camp while moving only between adjacent, safe-to-traverse cells.

```
import os
import json

# First, let's inspect the workspace directory to see what files are available
workspace_dir = 'workspace/'
print("Inspecting workspace directory...")
print(f"Workspace path: {workspace_dir}")

if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):
files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)
print(f"Files in workspace: {files}")

# Look for any files that might contain Earl's plot data
for file in files:
file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)
if os.path.isfile(file_path):
file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)
print(f"\nFile: {file}")
print(f"Size: {file_size} bytes")

# Try to peek at the content if it's a text-based file
try:
with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
content = f.read(200) # Read first 200 characters
print(f"Preview: {content[:100]}...")
except:
print("Binary file or read error")
else:
print("Workspace directory does not exist")

print("\n" + "="*50)
print("Next: Need to locate or reconstruct Earl's 49 green plots data")
print("This should include plot positions and their adjacency relationships")
```
developer
2025-08-10 15:36:16
Code Execution - Plan #6 (Iteration 1)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("API key found, proceeding with comprehensive search...") print("Searching for Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals") print("=" * 80) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting Luton Airport energy harvesting search_queries = [ 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles Pavegen', 'Luton Airport Pavegen energy harvesting installation', 'Luton expansion proposal energy harvesting infrastructure submission', 'Luton planning application energy harvesting rejected non-shortlisted', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor technology expansion', 'Luton Borough Council energy harvesting planning application', 'Planning Inspectorate Luton energy harvesting assessment', 'Luton Airport expansion energy harvesting infrastructure proposal', 'Pavegen Luton Airport floor tiles energy generation', 'Luton Airport sustainable energy harvesting planning submission', 'Luton energy harvesting expansion proposal rejected', 'Luton Airport green energy floor tiles planning permission' ] print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} different query strategies...") print("=" * 80) # Store all search results all_results = [] # Perform searches with different queries for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 60) # Prepare API request parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 15, # Get more results for comprehensive search "type": "search" } # Make API request to SerpAPI try: response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for query {i}") # Process and display results for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for key indicators combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_indicators = [ 'luton airport', 'luton', 'energy harvesting', 'pavegen', 'floor tiles', 'expansion proposal', 'planning application', 'rejected', 'non-shortlisted', 'luton borough council', 'planning inspectorate', 'infrastructure', 'energy generation', 'sustainable energy', 'green energy' ] matching_indicators = [indicator for indicator in key_indicators if indicator in combined_text] if len(matching_indicators) >= 4: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT - Contains {len(matching_indicators)} key indicators: {matching_indicators}") elif len(matching_indicators) >= 2: print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT - Contains {len(matching_indicators)} indicators: {matching_indicators}") print("-" * 40) # Store result with query info all_results.append({ 'query_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'matching_indicators': matching_indicators, 'relevance_score': len(matching_indicators) }) else: print(f"No organic results found for query {i}: '{query}'") else: print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) # Save all results to workspace for further analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') results_file = f'workspace/luton_airport_energy_harvesting_search_results_{timestamp}.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_purpose': 'Find Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals with rejection/non-shortlisted outcomes', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'queries': search_queries, 'results': all_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nSEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance matches print("\n\nANALYZING RESULTS FOR HIGH-RELEVANCE MATCHES...") print("=" * 50) # Sort results by relevance score high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 4] medium_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2 and r['relevance_score'] < 4] print(f"\nHigh relevance results (4+ indicators): {len(high_relevance_results)}") for result in high_relevance_results: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE:") print(f"Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Matching indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}") print("-" * 40) print(f"\nMedium relevance results (2-3 indicators): {len(medium_relevance_results)}") for result in medium_relevance_results[:10]: # Show top 10 medium relevance print(f"\n‚≠ê MEDIUM RELEVANCE:") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") print(f"Indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}") print("-" * 30) # Look for specific planning authority mentions print(f"\n\nPLANNING AUTHORITY ANALYSIS:") print("=" * 40) planning_authorities = {} authorities = ['luton borough council', 'planning inspectorate', 'luton council', 'planning authority'] for result in all_results: combined_text = f"{result['title'].lower()} {result['snippet'].lower()}" for authority in authorities: if authority in combined_text: if authority not in planning_authorities: planning_authorities[authority] = [] planning_authorities[authority].append(result) print(f"Planning authorities mentioned in search results:") for authority, mentions in planning_authorities.items(): print(f" {authority.title()}: {len(mentions)} mentions") if mentions: print(f" Top mention: {mentions[0]['title']}") # Look for rejection/assessment outcome indicators print(f"\n\nASSESSMENT OUTCOME ANALYSIS:") print("=" * 40) outcome_indicators = ['rejected', 'non-shortlisted', 'declined', 'refused', 'unsuccessful', 'not approved'] outcome_results = [] for result in all_results: combined_text = f"{result['title'].lower()} {result['snippet'].lower()}" for outcome in outcome_indicators: if outcome in combined_text: outcome_results.append({ 'result': result, 'outcome_type': outcome }) break print(f"Results mentioning assessment outcomes: {len(outcome_results)}") for outcome_result in outcome_results[:5]: # Show top 5 result = outcome_result['result'] outcome = outcome_result['outcome_type'] print(f"\nüìã OUTCOME MENTION ({outcome.upper()}):") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:150]}...") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print("-" * 30) print(f"\nSearch phase complete. Results saved for detailed analysis.") print(f"Next step: Analyze the saved results to identify specific Luton Airport energy harvesting installations and expansion proposals.")
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("API key found, proceeding with comprehensive search...") print("Searching for Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals") print("=" * 80) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting Luton Airport energy harvesting search_queries = [ 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles Pavegen', 'Luton Airport Pavegen energy harvesting installation', 'Luton expansion proposal energy harvesting infrastructure submission', 'Luton planning application energy harvesting rejected non-shortlisted', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor technology expansion', 'Luton Borough Council energy harvesting planning application', 'Planning Inspectorate Luton energy harvesting assessment', 'Luton Airport expansion energy harvesting infrastructure proposal', 'Pavegen Luton Airport floor tiles energy generation', 'Luton Airport sustainable energy harvesting planning submission', 'Luton energy harvesting expansion proposal rejected', 'Luton Airport green energy floor tiles planning permission' ] print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} different query strategies...") print("=" * 80) # Store all search results all_results = [] # Perform searches with different queries for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 60) # Prepare API request parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 15, # Get more results for comprehensive search "type": "search" } # Make API request to SerpAPI try: response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for query {i}") # Process and display results for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Store result with query info all_results.append({ 'query_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'matching_indicators': matching_indicators, 'relevance_score': len(matching_indicators) }) else: print(f"No organic results found for query {i}: '{query}'") else: print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) # Save all results to workspace for further analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') results_file = f'workspace/luton_airport_energy_harvesting_search_results_{timestamp}.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_purpose': 'Find Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles installations and expansion proposals with rejection/non-shortlisted outcomes', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'queries': search_queries, 'results': all_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nSEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance matches print("\n\nANALYZING RESULTS FOR HIGH-RELEVANCE MATCHES...") print("=" * 50) # Sort results by relevance score high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 4] medium_relevance_results = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2 and r['relevance_score'] < 4] print(f"\nHigh relevance results (4+ indicators): {len(high_relevance_results)}") for result in high_relevance_results: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE:") print(f"Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Matching indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}") print("-" * 40) print(f"\nMedium relevance results (2-3 indicators): {len(medium_relevance_results)}") for result in medium_relevance_results[:10]: # Show top 10 medium relevance print(f"\n‚≠ê MEDIUM RELEVANCE:") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") print(f"Indicators: {result['matching_indicators']}") print("-" * 30) # Look for specific planning authority mentions print(f"\n\nPLANNING AUTHORITY ANALYSIS:") print("=" * 40) planning_authorities = {} authorities = ['luton borough council', 'planning inspectorate', 'luton council', 'planning authority'] for result in all_results: combined_text = f"{result['title'].lower()} {result['snippet'].lower()}" for authority in authorities: if authority in combined_text: if authority not in planning_authorities: planning_authorities[authority] = [] planning_authorities[authority].append(result) print(f"Planning authorities mentioned in search results:") for authority, mentions in planning_authorities.items(): print(f" {authority.title()}: {len(mentions)} mentions") if mentions: print(f" Top mention: {mentions[0]['title']}") # Look for rejection/assessment outcome indicators print(f"\n\nASSESSMENT OUTCOME ANALYSIS:") print("=" * 40) outcome_indicators = ['rejected', 'non-shortlisted', 'declined', 'refused', 'unsuccessful', 'not approved'] outcome_results = [] for result in all_results: combined_text = f"{result['title'].lower()} {result['snippet'].lower()}" for outcome in outcome_indicators: if outcome in combined_text: outcome_results.append({ 'result': result, 'outcome_type': outcome }) break print(f"Results mentioning assessment outcomes: {len(outcome_results)}") for outcome_result in outcome_results[:5]: # Show top 5 result = outcome_result['result'] outcome = outcome_result['outcome_type'] print(f"\nüìã OUTCOME MENTION ({outcome.upper()}):") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:150]}...") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print("-" * 30) print(f"\nSearch phase complete. Results saved for detailed analysis.") print(f"Next step: Analyze the saved results to identify specific Luton Airport energy harvesting installations and expansion proposals.")
Execution Output
